result.execSummary:
The defendant Ryan J. Bellovary was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Criminal Damage to Property, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Ryan J. Bellovary in court with attorney Jaclyn R. Shelton.  Robert G. Barrington appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Discussion held.  Court makes record of conversation w/Atty Barrington off the record.  Atty Barrington requested to orally amend the criminal complaint to include criminal damage to property (943.01) and dismiss the domestic abuse enhancer.  No objection by Atty Shelton.  Court grants request.  Criminal complaint to be orally amended to include charge of criminal damage to property and dismiss the domestic abuse enhancer in count 1.  Court questions def and reviews chgs and pens.  State has complied w/victim rights notification.  NC plea entered in count 1 w/o domestic abuse enhancer;  NC plea entered in criminal damage charge.  Court accepts pleas and finds def guilty.  State heard on sentencing recomendation.  Atty Shelton responds.  Def makes stmt.  Court heard and imposes sentence as follows on each count:

18 mos probation - concurrent
30 days DCJ imposed & stayed w/h&t - concurrent
Def to report to probation by close of business tomorrow (5/20/15)
pay court costs on each charge
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 19, 2015 at 11:30 am.
Telephone scheduling conference on April 30, 2015 at 08:00 am.
Telephone scheduling conference on April 8, 2015 at 08:00 am.

Defendant Ryan J. Bellovary in court with attorney Jaclyn R. Shelton.  Kurt Frederich Klomberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty. Shelton changes plea to NG by reason of mental disease or defect; discussion on who appoints doctor; competency has not been raised yet in this case; Court enters NGI plea on Def.'s behalf and evaluation to be done; JT is removed; Court does not find sufficient basis to appoint a doctor and it is up to SPD to obtain doctor; scheduled for TSC 30 days out; bond cont.; further discussion on medications/diagnosis; SPD to provide said doctor report/evaluation
Defendant shall not have any violent or abusive contact with anyone.

Defendant Ryan J. Bellovary in court, in custody w/Intern Austin Heimann w/supervising attorney Jaclyn Shelton (eligible).  James T. Sempf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant has received copy of Criminal Complaint and advised of rights, charges and penalties. Court finds probable cause. RD & JT set. Court sets $350 PA bond with conditions:   Defendant shall not have any violent or abusive contact with anyone.  Return date scheduled for March 9, 2015 at 02:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for April 22, 2015 at 08:30 am.
